entities.description: A score variable ranging from 0 to 24 indicating the level of psychological distress during the worst month in the past year, excluding the past 30 days.
A series of six questions asking respondents how frequently they experienced symptoms of psychological distress during their worst month of the past year.
Symptoms include feeling nervous, hopeless, restless or fidgety, so sad or depressed that nothing could cheer them up, feeling everything was an effort, and feelings of worthlessness.
A score variable ranging from 0 to 24, representing a measure of how much difficulty the respondent had in performing daily activities due to problems with emotions, nerves, or mental health.
An alternative score variable ranging from 0 to 8, representing a measure of difficulty the respondent had with daily activities due to emotions, nerves, or mental health.

relationships.description: Indicates the level of psychological distress during the worst month in the past year.
Related to the frequency of six specific symptoms of psychological distress during the worst month of the past year.
Derived based on the K6 score if the respondent experienced significant distress.
An alternative measure of difficulty in daily activities due to emotions, nerves, or mental health.
